title: Installation issue: gmp - fails to build by gcc@9.2.0
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ git clone https://github.com/spack/spack
$ cd spack
$ git checkout releases/v0.13
$ source share/spack/setup-env.sh
$ spack compiler add --scope site
$ spack install gcc
```
update MODULEPATH, then
```console
$ ( module load gcc-9.2.0-_xxxxxxxxx_  ; spack compiler add --scope site )
$ spack install gmp
```
successfully re-installs prerequistes with gcc-9.2.0, then fails with
```console
[+] /usr/local/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-sandybridge/gcc-9.2.0/libtool-2.4.6-qfil4gsx6aeb747nnufo6tmw6xfyoidd
==> Installing gmp
[...]
==> Executing phase: 'configure'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/tmp/swinst/spack-stage/spack-stage-gmp-6.1.2-dimiyjtqtqxtsm3zgowftd7msx55dyc5/spack-src/configure' '--prefix=/usr/local/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-sandybridge/gcc-9.2.0/gmp-6.1.2-dimiyjtqtqxtsm3zgowftd7msx55dyc5' '--enable-cxx'
1 error found in build log:
     67    checking whether build system compiler is ANSI... yes
     68    checking for build system compiler math library... -lm
     69    checking whether we are using the GNU C++ compiler... yes
     70    checking whether /usr/local/spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++ accepts -g... yes
     71    checking C++ compiler /usr/local/spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++  -O2 -pedantic -fomit-frame-pointer -m64 -mtune=k8 -march=k8... no
     72    checking C++ compiler /usr/local/spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++  -g -O2... no
  >> 73    configure: error: C++ compiler not available, see config.log for details

See build log for details:
  /tmp/swinst/spack-stage/spack-stage-gmp-6.1.2-dimiyjtqtqxtsm3zgowftd7msx55dyc5/spack-build-out.txt
```
for more details and context, see [Spack v0.13 gcc 9.2.0 re-install fails with "C++ compiler not available"](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/spack/wYLV_jQZWiA)

### Platform and user environment
Tested on two systems:
Ubuntu server on virtual sandybridge machine
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux ubuntu18043server 4.15.0-74-generic #84-Ubuntu SMP Thu Dec 19 08:06:28 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
``` 
Centos 7 on physical broadwell cluster headnode
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux login 3.10.0-1062.9.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Dec 6 15:49:49 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release -d
Description:    Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.7 (Core)
```

$ spack spec --install-status gmp

```console
$ $ spack log-parse --show=errors,warnings /tmp/swinst/spack-stage/spack-stage-gmp-6.1.2-dimiyjtqtqxtsm3zgowftd7msx55dyc5/spack-build-out.txt
1 errors
2 warnings
     21    autoreconf: running: automake --add-missing --copy --force-missing
     22    configure.ac:2385: installing './compile'
     23    configure.ac:80: installing './missing'
  >> 24    Makefile.am:295: warning: source file 'cxx/dummy.cc' is in a subdirectory,
     25    Makefile.am:295: but option 'subdir-objects' is disabled
  >> 26    automake: warning: possible forward-incompatibility.
     27    automake: At least a source file is in a subdirectory, but the 'subdir-objects'
     28    automake: automake option hasn't been enabled.  For now, the corresponding output
     29    automake: object file(s) will be placed in the top-level directory.  However,
     ...
     70    checking whether /usr/local/spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++ accepts -g... yes
     71    checking C++ compiler /usr/local/spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++  -O2 -pedantic -fomit-frame-pointer -m64 -mtune=k8 -march=k8... no
     72    checking C++ compiler /usr/local/spack/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/g++  -g -O2... no
  >> 73    configure: error: C++ compiler not available, see config.log for details
```

Rebuilding with
```console
$ spack -d install -j 1 gmp
[...]
spack.util.executable.ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/tmp/swinst/spack-stage/spack-stage-gmp-6.1.2-dimiyjtqtqxtsm3zgowftd7msx55dyc5/spack-src/configure' '--prefix=/usr/local/spack/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-sandybridge/gcc-9.2.0/gmp-6.1.2-dimiyjtqtqxtsm3zgowftd7msx55dyc5' '--enable-cxx'
```
and inspection of the configure script suggests that the last argument could / should be '--enable-cxx=detect'

Fixing this in the gmp/package.py file
```console
 $ git diff var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/gmp/package.py
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/gmp/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/gmp/package.py
index 5e333f8..9c6c8f2 100644
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/gmp/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/gmp/package.py
@@ -41,4 +41,4 @@ class Gmp(AutotoolsPackage):
         return (flags, None, None)
 
     def configure_args(self):
-        return ['--enable-cxx']
+        return ['--enable-cxx=detect']
```
allows the installation to complete with no failure.
